did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, publications, research material, notebooks, course material.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Correspondence, reprints of Kingsbury's articles. Also course outlines, lecture notes and several notebooks belonging to Professor Howard Adelmann; and a photograph of Kingsbury and others at Woods Hole, 1897.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Professor of Histology and Embryology, Cornell University.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Correspondence concerning students, courses, graduate study, research and Sigma Xi matters; includes several letters from a former student written from the Women's Christian Medical College in Shanghai, China. Reprints of Kingsbury's articles. Also course outlines, lecture notes and several notebooks belonging to Professor Howard Adelmann; and a photograph of Kingsbury and others at Woods Hole, 1897. Correspondents include Cornell president Livingston Farrand, W.P. Van Wagenen, Simon Henry Gage, B.H. Grave, F.K. Richtmyer, Ross G. Harrison, Carl Zeiss Inc., K.M. Wiegand, and others.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: Cornell University. Department of Histology and Embryology.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Benjamin F. Kingsbury Papers, #14-26-1632. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Course outlines, lecture notes, and teaching notes for seminars
Reprints of articles, mainly by B.F. Kingsbury
